title: Three Forests Way Walking Route

images.title: Heading south on Three Forests Way by Roger Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Heading south on Three Forests Way in Hainault Forest Country Park near Chigwell.

images.title: Glyn Baker / Tributary to Pincey Brook
images.caption: Tributary to Pincey Brook. This area north of Hatfield Broad Oak is called The Marsh this stream feeds into Pincey Brook (behind the photographer) the path over it is the Three Forests Way long distance foot path.

images.title: Nigel Cox / Epping Forest: The Three Forests Way
images.caption: Epping Forest

images.title: Eleanor Dann / Earl's Path Pond
images.caption:
Earl's Path Pond in Epping Forest.
This pond, the remains of 19th-century gravel workings, is beside the Earl's Path and the Three Forests Way
The larger pond further south at Strawberry Hill is surrounded by woodland. Much of the woodland here is not "ancient", but has recovered after clearances.

images.title: Glyn Baker / Reservoir  Near Ardley End
images.caption: Reservoir Near Ardley End

images.title: Jurek and Trish  Sienkiewicz / Hatfield Forest
images.caption: Hatfield Forest

images.title: John Winfield, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Chipping Ongar, Essex

description: This circular walk links three fine forests in the Essex/Hertfordshire area - Hatfield Forest , Hainault Forest and Epping Forest. The walk passes Harlow , Loughton , the River Roding Valley , Arbidge, Chipping Ongar, Sawbridgeworth and Chigwell . All three forests have long peaceful walking paths while the route also includes a splendid waterside section along the River Stort near Harlow. On the way you can link up with the waymarked Epping Forest Centenary Walk .
